p: Many studies have confirmed that EOs are a complex of volatile compounds with high biological activities [ 2, 3, 4]. EOs can be extracted from various parts of plants, such as roots, rhizome, tubers, leaves, stems, bark, buds, flowers, inflorescences, seeds, and fruits, depending on the species and variety [ 5, 6]. Then, the recovered extracted EOs could be used in a wide variety of biological activities such as anti-cancer [ 7], antioxidant [ 8], anti-inflammatory [ 9] and antibacterial activities [ 6]. In addition, EOs improve the quality of the foods without residues in the product or the environment, so they are considered a safe alternative as food additives compared to synthetic agents [ 10].
